14 #include <cpu.hpp>

16 namespace RTSim {
17 
18  CPU::CPU(const std::string &name): Entity(name), frequencySwitching(0),
19  index(0)
20  {
21  cpuName = name;
22  PowerSaving = false;
23  }
24 
25 
26  CPU::CPU(const std::string &name, int num_levels, double V[], int F[]) :
27  Entity(name), frequencySwitching(0), index(0)
28  {
29  cpuName = name;
30 
31  // Setting voltages and frequencies
32  for (int i = 0; i < num_levels; i ++) {
33  cpulevel cl;
34  cl.voltage = V[i];
35  cl.frequency = F[i];
36  steps.push_back(cl);
37  }
38 
39  // Setting speeds (basing upon frequencies)
40  for (vector<cpulevel>::iterator iter = steps.begin();
41  iter != steps.end(); iter++)
42  (*iter).speed = ((double) (*iter).frequency) /
43  ((double)F[num_levels -1]);
44 
45  currentLevel = num_levels - 1;
46  PowerSaving = true;
47  }
48 
49 
50  CPU::~CPU()
51  {
52  steps.clear();
53  }
54 
55 
56  int CPU::getCurrentLevel()
57  {
58  if (PowerSaving)
59  return currentLevel;
60  else
61  return 0;
62  }
63 
64  double CPU::getMaxPowerConsumption()
65  {
66  int numlevels = steps.size();
67  if (PowerSaving)
68  return (steps[numlevels-1].frequency)*(steps[numlevels-1].voltage)*(steps[numlevels-1].voltage);
69  else
70  return 0;
71  }
72 
73  double CPU::getCurrentPowerConsumption()
74  {
75  if (PowerSaving)
76  return (steps[currentLevel].frequency)*(steps[currentLevel].voltage)*(steps[currentLevel].voltage);
77  else
78  return 0;
79  }
80 
81  double CPU::getCurrentPowerSaving()
82  {
83  if (PowerSaving) {
84  long double maxPowerConsumption = getMaxPowerConsumption();
85  long double saved = maxPowerConsumption - getCurrentPowerConsumption();
86  return (double) (saved/maxPowerConsumption);
87  }
88  else
89  return 0;
90  }
91 
92 
93  double CPU::setSpeed(double newLoad)
94  {
95  DBGENTER(_KERNEL_DBG_LEV);
96  DBGPRINT("pwr: setting speed in CPU::setSpeed()");
97  DBGPRINT("pwr: New load is " << newLoad);
98  if (PowerSaving) {
99  DBGPRINT("pwr: PowerSaving=on");
100  DBGPRINT("pwr: currentLevel=" << currentLevel);
101  for (int i=0; i < (int) steps.size(); i++)
102  if (steps[i].speed >= newLoad) {
103  if (i != currentLevel)
104  frequencySwitching++;
105  currentLevel = i;
106  DBGPRINT("pwr: New Level=" << currentLevel <<" New Speed=" << steps[currentLevel].speed);
107 
108  return steps[i].speed; //It returns the new speed
109  }
110  }
111  else
112  DBGPRINT("pwr: PowerSaving=off => Can't set a new speed!");
113 
114  return 1; // An error occurred or PowerSaving is not enabled
115  }
116 
117 
118  double CPU::getSpeed()
119  {
120  if (PowerSaving)
121  return steps[currentLevel].speed;
122  else
123  return 1;
124  }
125 
126 
127  double CPU::getSpeed (int level)
128  {
129  int numlevels = steps.size();
130  if ( (!PowerSaving) || (level > (numlevels - 1)) )
131  return 1;
132  else
133  return steps[level].speed;
134  }
135 
136  unsigned long int CPU::getFrequencySwitching()
137  {
138  DBGENTER(_KERNEL_DBG_LEV);
139  DBGPRINT("frequencySwitching=" << frequencySwitching);
140 
141  return frequencySwitching;
142  }

146 
147  void CPU::check(){
148  cout << "Checking CPU:" << cpuName << endl;;
149  cout << "Max Power Consumption is :" << getMaxPowerConsumption() << endl;;
150  for (vector<cpulevel>::iterator iter = steps.begin(); iter != steps.end(); iter++){
151  cout << "-Level-" << endl;
152  cout << "\tFrequency:" << (*iter).frequency << endl;
153  cout << "\tVoltage:" << (*iter).voltage << endl;
154  cout << "\tSpeed:" << (*iter).speed << endl;
155  }
156  for (int i=0; i < (int) steps.size(); i++)
157  cout << "Speed level" << getSpeed(i) << endl;
158  for (vector<cpulevel>::iterator iter = steps.begin(); iter != steps.end(); iter++){
159  cout << "Setting speed to " << (*iter).speed << endl;
160  setSpeed((*iter).speed);
161  cout << "New speed is " << getSpeed() << endl;
162  cout << "Current level is " << getCurrentLevel() << endl;
163  cout << "Current Power Consumption is " << getCurrentPowerConsumption() << endl;
164  cout << "Current Power Saving is " << getCurrentPowerSaving() << endl;
165  }
166  }

170  TracePowerConsumption::TracePowerConsumption(CPU* c, Tick period, char* filename) :
171  PeriodicTimer(period), TraceAscii(filename), counter(0),totalPowerSaved(0),totalPowerConsumed(0)
172  {
173  cpu = c;
174  }
175 
176  TracePowerConsumption::~TracePowerConsumption()
177  {
178  cpu = NULL;
179  }
180 
181  long double TracePowerConsumption::getAveragePowerSaving()
182  {
183  long double TPS = (totalPowerSaved) / ((long double) counter );
184  if (counter > 0) return TPS;
185  return 0;
186  }
187 
188  long double TracePowerConsumption::getAveragePowerConsumption()
189  {
190  long double TPC = (totalPowerConsumed) / ((long double) counter );
191  if (counter > 0) return TPC/(cpu->getMaxPowerConsumption());
192  return 0;
193  }
194 
195 
196  void TracePowerConsumption::action()
197  {
198  /* It periodically updates the variables: */
199  double currentPowerConsumption = cpu->getCurrentPowerConsumption();
200  totalPowerConsumed += currentPowerConsumption;
201  counter ++;
202 
203  long double TPC = getAveragePowerConsumption();
204  record("Average Power Consumption:");
205  record(TPC);
206  }

209  uniformCPUFactory::uniformCPUFactory()
210  {
211  _curr=0;
212  _n=0;
213  index = 0;
214  }
215 
216 
217  uniformCPUFactory::uniformCPUFactory(char* names[], int n)
218  {
219  _n=n;
220  _names = new char*[n];
221  for (int i=0; i<n; i++) {
222  _names[i]=names[i];
223  }
224  _curr=0;
225  index = 0;
226  }
227 
228 
229  CPU* uniformCPUFactory::createCPU(const string &name, int num_levels, double V[], int F[])
230  {
231  CPU *c;
232  if (_curr==_n)
233  if (num_levels==1)
234  // Creates a CPU without Power Saving:
235  c = new CPU(name);
236  else
237  // Creates a CPU with Power Saving:
238  c = new CPU(name, num_levels, V, F);
239  else
240  if (num_levels==1)
241  // Creates a CPU without Power Saving:
242  c = new CPU(_names[_curr++]);
243  else
244  // Creates a CPU with Power Saving:
245  c = new CPU(_names[_curr++], num_levels, V, F);
246 
247  c->setIndex(index++);
248  return c;
249  }
250 }
